name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Clearfield

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on our way from Columbus, OH to NJ and ran out of steam so we got off I-80 in Clearfield. The main drag is fast food, gas stations and hotels. We popped into three hotels before picking the Holiday Inn and chose this one based on appearance in and out (we checked out a room), cleanliness and value. Hotels all play games with price so here's what we got when we walked in. First you get the highest rate... the "rack rate." Rattle off things like AAA, AARP, and the price goes down. Tell them that's still too high and you're offered "The Manager's Rate." The best rate I was able to get was based on a "Room Saver" coupon from one of those booklets you get at the highway rest areas. We paid around $90 for a King.
reviews.title: What a Pleasand Surprise

reviews.text: I was really impressed with the lovely decor and clean, crisp look of the hotel, lobby, dining area, room and bathroom. It truly looked like the property had just been renovated, though I was told it was a few years old. Our room on the third floor was spacious, immaculate, and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Enjoyable overnight stay

reviews.text: The next morning we had their free continental breakfast in the dining area and it was really a full breakfast with scrambled eggs, fresh pancakes, bacon, yogurt, fruit, bagels, muffins and lots more. Though we were the only ones in the dining area, there was an employee there hunting for crumbs to pick up and having a hard time.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Honestly, I don't stay in Holiday Inns because of prior problems I've had with them. This property was so different, so clean and well managed, it simply doesn't seem to fit the brand. I would gladly return to this hotel if in the area and highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at this Hoiliday Inn Express for an over night stAy. I had business in the area the next morning. From the moment I walked through the doors until the time I departed the next day, it was an enjoyable stay. Every employee I passed or interacted with was pleasant and welcoming. The hotel was very clean without exception. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. I do plan on staying here when I return for business again.
reviews.title: Very Good Service and Clean Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here overnight while traveling to Michigan. The location was convenient. It was clean and the ladies at the front desk were friendly and helpful. We also loved the welcome bag they give you upon check in. After a long drive, that bottle of water and snacks they gave us were appreciated. Our room was spacious with a fridge and microwave. The breakfast was great, I just wish they had a few healthier choices. But overall, I was impressed by it. We wont hesitate to stay here again on future trips!
reviews.title: Great stay right off of Route 80
Excellent place to stop
reviews.text: On our drive from Chicago to New York we stayed here for the night. The rooms were impeccably clean and smelled very fresh. The bathroom was well stocked and very clean as well. I thought the place was brand new but it's 11 years-old. I recommend this place all the way around.

Stayed overnight on way from NYC to Cleveland for the weekend, it's about half way so it's a good spot to break up the trip. Hotel was solid, not amazing but very solid, and was a good value. Staff was friendly, room was comfortable and clean. All in all a good stay.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, Friendly

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night on a business trip. Convenient location, right off I 80. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Pool and hot tub very nice. The breakfast offered, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, juices, coffee, fruit, cereal, yogurt, fresh cinnamon buns, bagels, muffins, etc. and everything I had was very good. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for overnight stay

reviews.text: We want commend the staff at the front desk and in particular Teona for going out of her way to help us resolve a reservation problem during our stay on May 7th. Due to a computer error we were given two reservations for the same night on May 22nd for our return trip. We tried to resolve this over the phone with hotels.com but could not get any results. She volunteered to help us and spent almost an hour on the phone until she was able to resolve the problem. She was exceptionally patient and professional during this process. She is an excellent employee and deserves credit.
reviews.title: Resolving a problem

reviews.text: Apperently it is the policy of this particular Holiday Inn to not allow fun outside your room. I Have been to several Holiday Inn's in this country and other IHG brand hotels around he world and never had a problem like this, do not attempt to BBQ and play corn hole, while having a beer in the parking lot or you will be asked to leave. If you attempt it you will asked to leave with no refund for the day. As I am a Platnuim priority club member for over 10 years I was shocked at this "policy" they say they have. I had frequented this Clearfield hotel many times before and never had a problem, just think they could have handled it different. Thank you for you time, hope this helps other fun loving travelers make an informed decision.
reviews.title: No fun allowed here.

reviews.text: We booked 9 consecutive nights at various Holiday Inn Express hotels as part of our round trip from Toronto down to the Washington DC/Philadelphia area and back...
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel but issues with service

reviews.text: We spent the first night of this trip at Clearfield PA location which had a room with 2 Queen beds as we were looking for (with 4 in our party)...
reviews.title: Simply the best!

reviews.text: We had also reserved a roll away/cot so we could 'spread out a bit' and all have a more comfortable sleep
reviews.title: great hosts and value

reviews.text: - Well.... we arrived at the hotel and were told that there were no more cots and nothing else could be done to accommodate our needs
reviews.title: Great Stay
Brand new, just opened July 2013
reviews.text: Super nice hotel, brand new! Staff was very nice and professional. Nice sitting area outside (no smoking, no alcohol)? Front desk was great and allowed early check in when the room was clean. Nice layout to the hotel, 3 floors, breakfast area and an indoor pool.

We stayed at the new location during opening week. Everything was spotless, sparkling, good quality, and up to date. What a treat for this fussy reviewer. We ordered in food from a tasty Italian family owned place recommended by the staff. Good stuff! The complimentary breakfast in the morning had wide variety of hot and cold offerings. All yummy. Will stay again for sure.
reviews.title: This is for the New location at 1625 Industrial Park Road--EXCELLENT

reviews.text: This hotel listed is now a Super 8 or something. The new location of the Holiday Inn Express is 1625 Industrial Park Road .. We were there two nights ago on it's second night of operation.Any brand new hotel is a treat, especially a purpose built Holiday inn Express, but this place was absolutely exceptional! All of the "kinks" had already been worked out, the place was totally spotless, no construction debris, the rooms were quiet, the water pressure was strong, air conditioning was cold, beds were superb and we had one of the best night's sleep in a hotel in a very long time! Even the traditional express breakfast was much better than usual!! The staff was very friendly, actually they were exceptional!!! Wireless was strong and fast. If you need a reason to go to Clearfield, I have just given it to you!! We were so very impressed and delighted, obviously! I wish management well and I hope that they keep up the good work!
reviews.title: This is for the New location at 1625 Industrial Park Road ..WOW, WOW, WOW!!

reviews.text: My husband and I were passing through Clearfield on our way home to Kentucky.We picked up one of those travel books at the Welcome Center and used it to get a great rate at this hotel. I wish we had this hotel for our whole trip!!! We had a room with two double beds. The room also had a refrigerator, ironing board, and iron. The rooms were extremely clean and well decorated. The bathrooms were well maintained and the shower head/ shower pressure was awesome. The lobby had snacks and water available in the evenings and it had a great breakfast. You could have yogurt to pancakes. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone passing through Clearfield.
reviews.title: Wish I had this one for my whole trip!!!

reviews.text: This was our second stay. Our first stay was so nice that we have been looking for Holiday Inn Express as our go-to when traveling on the road. I am looking for kind staff and most important a clean facility. This fits the bill.
reviews.title: Makes you rethink hotels

description: Welcome to the award winning Clearfield Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites; the 'smart' place to stay! Start your day with an invigorating shower and then enjoy our deluxe Continental breakfast. We are located directly off of Interstate 80 on Route 879 with easy access to Route 322. When looking for area events, a multitude of activities await you. Grice Museum, Historica Plus, as well as the Clearfield County Fair are all located less than 5 miles away. For those seeking outdoor activities; visit Curwensville Lake & Recreation Area, Parker Dam State Park, S.B. Elliot State Park, Black Moshannon State Park, or take advantage of the Pennsylvania State Initiative Rails to Trails providing miles of walking, jogging, and biking along scenic pathways alongside the Susquehanna River; or enjoy a round of golf. For those avid hunters and anglers, Clearfield County boasts some of the best fishing and hunting in Pennsylvania. When looking for a challenge in dining, visit Denny s Beer Barrel Pub, featuring the world s largest burger! For those with more discriminating appetites, visit Hedges, Moena s, or Daniel s. Those who desire the simple and quicker meals various fast food restaurants are within walking distance or have delivery from either Pizza Hut or Domino s.We are also located near Shawville Power Plant, Walmart Distribution, Clearfield Hospital, Bionol, and Quehanna Bootcamp.
